page.title: 14A Local Farmer. Holywell.
page.content: Mr and Mrs M. moved to Holywell from Sutton in 1942.They now run an arable farm.Mrs M.used to be a teacher.They both enjoy living in the country.Mr M.'s parents are dead and Mrs M.'s mother lives in Durham.A son lives in St Ives and a daughter and another son live in Cambridge.They both belong to local societies and enjoy reading, walking and gardening.Mr M.is interested in the sport of hare coursing.They think the biggest changes have been the increase in traffic and new houses.Mr M.doesn't approve of the amount of chemicals used in modern farming methods and Mrs M.thinks there ought to be more jobs for people.Mrs M. shops in St Ives, Ramsey and Cambridge.They own two cars so can get around independently.
